page.title: 14Harvest at Beaumont
page.content: The combined harvester used on our farm has a table on the front of it. There is a reel which is fixed to the table which pulls the Barley to the cutter bar. There is an auger that goes onto a belt which takes the Barley into a drum. From there it goes up into a separater to remove the straw and is then stored. The straw is baled using an 'International' baler. A sledge fits behind the baler which collects the bales using a horse-shoe spring. Bales are automatically put on alternate sides of the sledge. When full, the bales are dropped by the sledge. A grab follows which picks up the bales. These are stacked six bales high. Then the forty eight bales are automatically picked up by a trailer.
